Class Patron

  • java.lang.Object
    • Patron
  • class Patron
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a library patron that has a name and assigns values to different literary aspects of books.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      (package private) int comicTend
      The tendency of this patron to comic books
      (package private) int dramaticTend
      The tendency of this patron to dramatic books
      (package private) int educationalTend
      The tendency of this patron to educational books
      (package private) int enjoymentThreshold
      The minimal literary value a book must have for this patron to enjoy it.
      (package private) java.lang.String firstName
      The first name of this patron.
      (package private) java.lang.String lastName
      The last name of this patron.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Patron​(java.lang.String patronFirstName, java.lang.String patronLastName, int comicTendency, int dramaticTendency, int educationalTendency, int patronEnjoymentThreshold)
      Creates a new patron with the given characteristics.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      (package private) int getBookScore​(Book book)
      Returns the literary value this patron assigns to the given book.
      (package private) java.lang.String stringRepresentation()
      Returns a string representation of the patron, which is a sequence of its first and last name, separated by a single white space.
      (package private) boolean willEnjoyBook​(Book book)
      Returns true of this patron will enjoy the given book, false otherwise.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Patron

        Patron​(java.lang.String patronFirstName,
       java.lang.String patronLastName,
       int comicTendency,
       int dramaticTendency,
       int educationalTendency,
       int patronEnjoymentThreshold)
        Creates a new patron with the given characteristics.
        Parameters:
        patronFirstName - The first name of the patron.
        patronLastName - The last name of the patron.
        comicTendency - The weight the patron assigns to the comic aspects of books.
        dramaticTendency - The weight the patron assigns to the dramatic aspects of books.
        educationalTendency - The weight the patron assigns to the educational aspects of books.
        patronEnjoymentThreshold - The minimal literary value a book must have for this patron to enjoy it.

    • Method Detail

      • stringRepresentation

        java.lang.String stringRepresentation()
        Returns a string representation of the patron, which is a sequence of its first and last name, separated by a single white space. For example, if the patron's first name is "Ricky" and his last name is "Bobby", this method will return the String "Ricky Bobby".
        Returns:
        the literary value this patron assigns to the given book.

      • getBookScore

        int getBookScore​(Book book)
        Returns the literary value this patron assigns to the given book.
        Parameters:
        book - The book to asses.
        Returns:
        the literary value this patron assigns to the given book.

      • willEnjoyBook

        boolean willEnjoyBook​(Book book)
        Returns true of this patron will enjoy the given book, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        book - The book to asses.
        Returns:
        true of this patron will enjoy the given book, false otherwise.
